page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES IN DRUMOAK
page.content: The biggest change to be seen in Drumoak is in agriculture and its methods.Farms have become mechanised and labour forces have decreased. This has meant a decline in agriculture related trades such as {saddlery,blacksmithing and meal {milling (oatmeal). } {Cottar houses}(farm labourers' houses) therefore are not now occupied by {fee'd men}(hired men),but have been renovated and sold. Local tradesmen too,suffered when everyone got motor cars,for housewives were able to travel to nearby towns for their shopping,instead of relying on travelling vans.Small shopkeepers could not compete in goods or prices. {The Transport Act,1962,}meant the withdrawal of all train services on Deeside and{26th, February 1966}saw the last passenger train in Drumoak.
